title: Ethiopian bee-eater
text:
The Ethiopian bee-eater ("Merops lafresnayii") is a species of <a href="bird">bird</a> in the family <a href="Meropidae">Meropidae</a>.
It is found in <a href="Ethiopia">Ethiopia</a> and <a href="Sudan">Sudan</a>. It was formerly considered a subspecies of the <a href="blue-breasted%20bee-eater">blue-breasted bee-eater</a>.
The Ethiopian bee-eater is a <a href="rainforest">rainforest</a> bird usually found singly. It perches on a high branch in the <a href="Canopy%20%28biology%29">canopy</a> beside tracks and clearings and swoops down on small butterflies, honeybees and other insects before returning to its original perch.
